nodes.Description:
CWE-627: Dynamic Variable Evaluation
In a language where the user can influence the name of a variable at runtime, if the variable names are not controlled, an attacker can read or write to arbitrary variables, or access arbitrary functions.
nodes.label: Dynamic Variable Evaluation

nodes.Description:
CWE-99: Improper Control of Resource Identifiers ('Resource Injection')
The product receives input from an upstream component, but it does not restrict or incorrectly restricts the input before it is used as an identifier for a resource that may be outside the intended sphere of control.
nodes.label: Improper Control of Resource Identifiers ('Resource Injection')

nodes.Description:
CWE-694: Use of Multiple Resources with Duplicate Identifier
The product uses multiple resources that can have the same identifier, in a context in which unique identifiers are required.
nodes.label: Use of Multiple Resources with Duplicate Identifier

nodes.Description:
CWE-914: Improper Control of Dynamically-Identified Variables
The product does not properly restrict reading from or writing to dynamically-identified variables.
nodes.label: Improper Control of Dynamically-Identified Variables

nodes.Description:
CWE-621: Variable Extraction Error
The product uses external input to determine the names of variables into which information is extracted, without verifying that the names of the specified variables are valid. This could cause the program to overwrite unintended variables.
nodes.label: Variable Extraction Error

nodes.Description:
CWE-641: Improper Restriction of Names for Files and Other Resources
The product constructs the name of a file or other resource using input from an upstream component, but it does not restrict or incorrectly restricts the resulting name.
nodes.label: Improper Restriction of Names for Files and Other Resources

nodes.Description:
CWE-462: Duplicate Key in Associative List (Alist)
Duplicate keys in associative lists can lead to non-unique keys being mistaken for an error.
nodes.label: Duplicate Key in Associative List (Alist)

nodes.Description:
CWE-102: Struts: Duplicate Validation Forms
The product uses multiple validation forms with the same name, which might cause the Struts Validator to validate a form that the programmer does not expect.
nodes.label: Struts: Duplicate Validation Forms
